org.orgName: Samuel C. and Charles N. Baker
Samuel C. and Charles N. Baker

note.p: Poulterers and dealers in game and live animals. Proprietors were brothers Samuel Camfield Baker (1810–66) and Charles Newcomb Baker (1813–78). Premises at 3 Half Moon Passage, Gracechurch Street, London, and 15a Beaufort Street and 152 Kings Road (‘The Pheasantry’), Chelsea, and at the rue de la Faisanderie, avenue de l’Impératrice, Paris.
Census returns of England and Wales 1861 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG9/227/10/17), 1871 (RG10/82/75/28), 1901 (RG13/72/122/1)
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966, 1973–95 (Ancestry.com, accessed 21 March 2017)
England, select births and christenings, 1538–1975 (Ancestry.com, accessed 21 March 2017)
